If one is familiar with the way money is moved in the ME, it would be nothing more than idle speculation as to where and how occupation opposition funds originate.
It's more than idle speculation, so be careful. Recall our last exchange when you made bold and very specific assertions of 'fact' about the Trans-Afghan pipeline that ultimately were shown to be false. Now you dismiss as 'idle speculation' the accumulating evidence that some of the proceeds from the oil-for-food scandal are helping to finance, in part, the Iraqi insurgency. 
 
 For starters, I refer you to the "Comprehensive Report of the Special Advisor to the DCI on Iraq's WMD," more commonly known as the Duelfer Report. The URL links to a hefty 53MB pdf file. Annex B contains lists of known oil voucher recipients. Note that the Mujahedin-e Khalq (MEK), a designated terrorist organization allied with Saddam's regime, received oil vouchers worth millions of dollars. The Duelfer Report shows that MEK sold their vouchers through Century Marketing, a British company. Though Duelfer's fruitless search for WMD's ended last year, his investigation did show that illicit proceeds of the scandal made their way into the bank account of a terrorist organization.
 
 In view of such documented and growing evidence, I submit that 'idle speculation' more aptly describes your own state of thinking that investigators cannot discern any origins of insurgency funding due to 'the way money is moved in the ME.'
 
 Considering your presumed familiarity with how money moves in the region, please enlighten readers with your knowledge of how bankers and front companies, couriers and money-launderers still network together to handle Saddam's billions of dollars in oil-for-food kickbacks. The vast amounts of cash at stake are indicated in the U.S. military's recovery of at least four separate hauls of metal boxes, roughly 200 so far, each containing $4M. Those boxes alone amount to nearly a billion dollars.
 
 To pretend that none of the billions Saddam skimmed from the UN program is helping to fund the insurgency is perhaps the height of naivete on this subject.
